Articles.Content:
Am I missing something or some sub-menu somewhere or does the game really not give you the tools to do the job?

For example, it's kind of important to know the best launch window to get to another planet - phase angle etc. Am I missing the tool that tells me what the phase angle is to the target planet, or does this just not exist?
Also, they REALLY need to make it so it's easier to fine tune your maneuvers when trying to intercept planets, as well as having the option for the engine to automatically cut off when your maneuver is complete. I know its a "game" but it's difficult to be accurate given the tools we have and doesn't feel "realistic".

Finally, what's up with not being able to set maneuvers when the game is paused? Is this a bug or by design? Again, I know it's a game but it feels silly to have  to do it quickly on the fly when in reality all of that would have been calculated before lift off. I don't want everything to be automatic as obviously that would take some of the fun away, but at least allow me to pause and think. I'm not an ACTUAL rocket scientist.

Edited January 9 by tweaked9107

There is not currently an in game tool for transfer window calculation or planning. There's a few websites to do it and I'm assuming that eventually they'll be an in game mode.

The maneuver node system is something devs have stated they're reviewing to make more useable. I don't believe they'll add anything to automatically fly or cut off a maneuver, a core part of the game is flying the rockets. If you want this, mods are the best option.

I'm unsure why we can't mess with maneuvers when the game is paused. We definitely should be able to.
It is indeed missing tools the player needs and that is one of my biggest complaints about it currently.

It doesn't exist in the game, sadly, though a search for AlexMoon transfer planner will give you a good web tool with - If anything - too much precise info on when and how to transfer

Also, they REALLY need to make it so it's easier to fine tune your maneuvers when trying to intercept planets
